intro: Afroligusticum runssoricum, commonly known as the African spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and forest understory environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
